Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Kleber”
Reviews.Author: FrancesLargs
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 enjoyable days at the Kleber Hotel,Paris, brilliant location. Could walk to all the significant land marks etc. which was a bonus. If travelling was necessary, public transport (metro, bus, airport bus) is right on the doorstep. Staff very friendly and informative. Breakfast was more than adequate, fresh and very tasty. We loved the informal nature of hotel. Bit disappointed in the lack of satellite service - especially for those evenings -after sight-seeing all day - when we had little energy left. But overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Kleber Hotel and we hope to go back some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “nice and righgt place”
Reviews.Author: shahram j Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very nice with friendly staff .rooms were very clean and sound level in hotel was very low manager was very help full and kind when i was asking him a question he wa spendig time and gave us the best answer for example asking direction. when i go back to paris i use this hotel again and i recomend this hotel to my ferinds and familly.

Reviews.Title: “very good location, interested design”
Reviews.Author: hiszpan
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in Hotel Kleber just because my friend advised me this hotel. It is located in central Paris with walking distance to Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. The hotel is very well decorated inside and you will the "age" of the building. Room was ok, suprisingly spacious and clean. However there was very unpleasant smell in the lift. Additionally there is very stupid way of closing room doors - key hole is located very close to door knob and you have to have very tiny hand to do it without pain! Bed was very comfortable and I had a room opposite to the street so it was very quiet in the night too.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs of the Kleber”
Reviews.Author: Basya
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel and was quite impressed. Impressions are both with plus and minus. On the bright side: location, price, staff attitude, fair comfort and antique if you like it. I do and that's why I chose this hotel. On the dark side: houskeeping does very basic cleaning, i.e. they change towels and wipe the basin and toilet (?) and make beds. They probably wipe wooden floors as well however have no proof of that in my room. But that's all they do. There were 2 mirrows in my room and one of them was probably cleaned a couple of years ago if ever. The web on the wall above my head was horrible, bde head stead wasn't cleaned for ages (I cleaned it with the wet tissue),2 glass wall bed lights were dusty, the radiator in the bathroom was clean only it its upper half, the lower part wss black instead of white between rails. Jacuzi perhaps hasn't been used for ages and when I tried to switch it on the dirt went out of holes together with horrible smell. The hotel doesn't provide hair conditioner, only hair and body gel and body lotion. They do not replace bottles daily. I also have never seen the hotel that doesn't put a new sop bar daily. Towels are clean but very old. Bathroom is so dark that it's impossible to do make up or style your hair. I think that one of the lights was uot of order. Speaking of the lights the room itself is quite dark but that was ok for me. However if you need to do some work at the desk than it is a problem as there is no table lamp. They don't have blinds but just heavy gardines which looked stylish but if your room is facing the street you have to close curtains almost everytime you are in the room. Bathroom has a glass wall so to dress up or undress in the bathroom is not an option. But you can still watch TV while taking a shower which is a plus. Also there were no batthroom cups even plastic ones. Never seen this before. There were only two small shot glasses for not clear what purpose- not suitable for wine or water anyway. No hook in the bathroom as well and the door is sliding. there is no shelf for your stuff as well, just a bit of space on both side of the basin. Worked for me though. Bedding was clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable but the wool blanket looked like it came directly from barracks or hospital of 50s.Did not look antique at all. There is no hotel guest book, note pad, pen, etc, or any information about the hotel except of the breakfast prices. Did not eat breakfast though. There is no tea/coffee facilities in the room so if you prefer your first cup of tea in bed, bring your own kettle, etc. The front door of the room was in "antique" condition and won't close until you have to lift it. Good physical exercise, perhaps. Amonth other positives - My room faced the street but there we no disturbance during the night and I am very light sleeper. The hotel is non smolking but if you must to smoke ask for a room with a balcony or notify the staff but in this case there is an extra charge of 29 eu per night. All staff are French which is so rear nowdays and they speak good English. They are very polite and helpful but I've got the feeling if there is a serious problem you'll not achives much with them. Typical I'm afraid. However they are perfect in calling for a taxi (I didn't wait for more than 5-6 minutes), booking restaurants and sightseeing. As I said before the hotel is decorated in antique style and furnished with real antiques. That is very unusual for a small hotel and makes a very pleasant impression. All in all I had a very nice stay and did not have any complains. If you are visiting Kleber just be aware of their "minuses" and bring your own shampoo, soap, kettle, etc. The location is fantastic, the hotel in general is very nice for what you pay for and I am definitely staying there againg should I wish to be in this part of Paris. Hope you will enjoy your stay as I did. I would like to thank all the staff for their great efforts to make my stay as pleasant as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, but tiny bedroom.”
Reviews.Author: Karl013
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe, with numerous cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel reception is nicely decorated and the staff on reception very friendly and helpful. The bedroom and bathroom were tiny (like most are in Paris) but it was still charming. The surrounding streets were very quiet in the evening but the Kleber metro stop near the Arc de Triomphe is close by (as well as another metro stop) so it wasn't difficult to go across town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: magicalmad
Reviews.Content: This hotel's most winning factor is it's fantastic location. 10 minute walk away from Champs-Elysees and the Eiffel Tower ! It is very cute inside, the decor is unusual but definitely gives the hotel some authentic French Character. The rooms are small but of a reasonbly good standard. After viewing a few rooms, we choose one on the street side as the view is much nicer and the street is very quiet so there was no traffic noise. The staff were friendly. The only downside was the breakfast. Tinned fruit salad ect. We only had breakfast one day, after that decided to search out nearby bakeries for a fresh croissant, much better! The price was good, we got an individual quote, which was much less than the rate on the website! (120 euros per night) so for this rate I thought it was great given its proximity to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a good location with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Suilven
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the earlier, very critical reviews, it's clear that things have improved greatly at the Kleber. There's been a programme of renovation and the lift, for example, is now modern and works well. The hotel is situated in a relatively quiet side street, half way between two metro stations and close to bus stops. The Arc de Triomphe and the west end of the Champs-Elysees are nearby, less than ten minutes' walk. In the other direction, it's about a fifteen minute stroll to the banks of the Seine, at which point the Tour Eiffel is just across the river. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. We mostly spoke (slightly rusty) French but they were just as happy to use English. The bedroom wasn't huge, but we didn't feel cramped. Like the rest of the hotel, it was nicely equipped with older and antique furniture. There was a large jacuzzi bath which had somehow been fitted into a fairly small but perfectly adequate bathroom. Although there were some minor signs of wear - scuffed paint here and there, for example - the room was clean. The free wifi worked well. There is an option to have breakfast in the hotel's breakfast room, in the basement, priced (when we stayed) at €14. We tried it on our first morning and had a good selection of cold meats, fresh and dried fruit, cheeses, boiled eggs, breads, cakes and croissants. However, we wanted to try a different place for breakfast each day and there are several cafés nearby. Le Corner Café, on the other side of Avenue Kleber and a little towards the south-west, did a cooked breakfast for about the same price, offering omelettes, scrambled eggs or oeufs au plat, which in this case meant no fewer than four fried eggs. We found other good places just a little farther away. We also enjoyed some very indulgent afternoon patisserie at a little tearoom almost directly across Av. Kleber and a little to the left. We would very happily return to the Kleber. It had everything we needed for a short break and the whole experience was very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good base location for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan_Iluka
Reviews.Content: It was nice to be greeted warmly and offered a room upgrade with a spa and balcony. The room was not large but very clean and most comfortable. The Reception staff were very helpful with suggestions on places to visit and directions to get there. Central to the major attractions and close to the rail was a big plus to walk easily around. There were plenty of restaurants, bars and convenience shopping close by. Short walk or long walk you would find what you are looking for. No hesitation staying there again as us Aussies have a saying "if you are on to a good thing stick to it."

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to many amenities...”
Reviews.Author: cwil2go
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was easy enough to find. Right in between 2 Metro stations. Very reasonable walking distance to L'Arc de Triumph, Eiffel & Champs Elysee. A few ok cafes, a few restaurants in little out of the way corners, a corner store, a supermarket and a very good Patisserie nearby but not a bustling centre which was fine as it made for quiet streets at night. We walked to the supermarket to buy water & fruit each night and over to the patisserie for a yummy brecky each morning. The A/C wasn't working but the weather was gorgeous so we got away with leaving the window open at night. The room we were in was smallish but fit a double bd, table, chair & minifridge. The bathroom was clean w/ roomy standup, no tub. Decor was very very pink & old French I suppose...a little worn but comfortable. The whole hotel only has a few floors with 3-4 rms per flr but they have a good elevator. The lobby is quaint with murals on the walls & again old style French furniture. Staff was fluent in English & very tolerant of our French. There were a few little misunderstandings (over borrowing an adapter & ordering a airport shuttle) but nothing very serious. They seemed knowledgeable enough & tolerant of our questions...though they didn't understand that we wanted to go to an open market or where to shop for deals that weren't at the glitzy malls. They had free wifi so we just googled it ourselves anyways & I think got better info. Overall it was alright...not 5 star but you don't pay for that so don't expect it. It was comfortable. Keep in mind that because its near the Arc that its at one end of the Champs Elysee...its quite the day hike to get to the Louvre. Might be nice to walk just the once so you can take in the sites & scenery but take the Metro the rest of the time & save your feet...sooo quick & easy to get everywhere with it.

Reviews.Title: “Just a jump to the left......traditional hotel and a thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Woowoo101
Reviews.Content: First thing I did was google map where the hotel was located. I would recommend this to anyone. You have time to look at the surroundings (with Street view) whilst sat on the sofa instead of lugging luggage from street to street. Anyhow, I knew the hotel was near to the Arc de triomphe and my wife and I took the Air France bus, route 2 from the Airport at Charles de Gaule to Arc de triomphe. Cost was around 19 euros for two with the knowledge that any traffic jams would not see a taxi fare spiraling out of control. A short walk and we were there at the hotel. It was dark when we arrived so once again…check Google maps first. Got stung with a City tax of around 8 euros a night at the hotel. Didn’t expect that one, especially as I thought everything was paid for. Have to admit the pink room took us aback but it was at the top of the hotel and quiet. There was a safe within a lockable wardrobe. Bed was comfy and free internet made the hotel a really nice place to stay for the money. Tried the breakfast one day at 14 euros each. It was typical French cuisine with breads, jams, cereal and coffee. The smell of fresh bread could be smelt each morning around 06:30…what a great way to wake up. Other days was good old Mc D bacon and egg muffin. God Bless America!! Took the stairs from the 6th floor and discovered they were renovating the 2-5 floors. Workers weren’t noisy but started at 8am. We are always awake by then but for those that like a late lie then it would have disturbed them. Our last night had a family with young kids in the room next door. Baby wouldn’t stop crying, evening and in the middle of the night. My request for a quiet room obviously not valid for the final evening. Spent our final day at Galleries Lafayette. One can pick up the 22 bus just around the corner from the hotel and it drops you off at the Opera (next to the Shopping). All for 3 euros for two persons. Google maps again revealed the Riossy bus was but 20m away and 18 euros had us on the bus directly back to the airport. Hotel certainly within walking of the Arc de triomphe, Eiffel Tower and Lourves Museum (cough, this one is a long walk). Nice hotel and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: strawberry_501
Reviews.Content: We got a fabulous deal at £70 a night. As such, felt the room was value for money particularly as we were using it as a pit stop. The rooms are not overly large but certainly comfortable for two people, and the bathroom was functional. One criticism is that the central staircase acted like an atrium and the acoustics of each level would travel all the way through the hotel. Location wise, the hotel is definitely on a great spot right between the Arch de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. Nearby bistros were a tad touristy by nature. We enjoyed our meals nonetheless. The metro was extremely easy to use and because of the summer holidays, there were no crowds. A very relaxing time of the year to go to Paris. Hotel Kleber is definitely deserved of its 3 star rating. Not sure if it's worth the 4 stars they claim they will be receiving though.

Reviews.Title: “small room in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gourmandspain
Reviews.Content: the location of this 3* hotel is excellent (walking distance to Etoile, Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee, etc) but the rooms are very small and somewhat "cheesy". Not sure why the Michelin Guide rates it as a "red" hotel. However, if you can get a "deluxe" room at around €105 per night including breakfast and taxes then it is exceptionally good value for such an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience (but unexpected seeing other reviews!)”
Reviews.Author: Gunder
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip where I stayed in Hotel Kleber for 1 night for the Paris Marathon. Before booking this hotel I had not looked at the reviews on here (as I usual do) as I was being guided by price and specifically proximity to the Arc de Triomphe for the marathon start line. So coming on here this morning and seeing all the negative reviews I was very surprised! Now I always take very negative and completely glowing reviews with a pince of salt as people tend to get very emotional about their experiences rather than being objective. But the number of negative reviews does tend to suggest something is up...however I have to say we had a perfectly nice experience at this charming hotel. The reception is beautifully presented and the manager went out of his way to make our stay as pleasant as possible and took care of a number of special requests based on the nature of our visit. Yes the lift is small, but so what? It works and it gets you to the right floor, there's no need to get too upset about this unless you are transporting an elephant to your room. Our room was very modern and a lot more spacious than other central hotels in Paris. The plasma tv was excellent, the bed comfortable and the jacuzzi bath a huge hit! Yes there is a see-through mirror between the bedroom and the bathroom but personally I had no problem with that, my wife and I are not one of those toilet-phobe couples! The surrounding area is also fantastic with some superb restuarants, bars and sights to visit. The hotel is about 5 minutes away from the Arc de Triomphe. I'm not saying other negative reviewers are wrong but we just didn't have the same experience. Having stayed at a number of hotels in Paris this was far better than any of them. Trying to decide whether to stay here or not would be a tough call based on the reviews completed to date, but I'm happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a joke!!!!! Broken lift, poor security, falling apart, no heat..”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsCassy
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip in July, 2008 hoping for a fun, New Year's Eve getaway. What a mistake!!!!! From the outset we had trouble with this hotel. When calling to confirm reservation, we were advised that the online booking agency "had made a mistake" and that our room rate would be 259 Euros per night instead of the 89 Euros per night we had pre-paid for the three night stay. IN spite of the fact that the online agent intervened and supposedly "corrected" the "misconception" when we went to check in we were forcefully reminded that we needed to pay the additional fee(s). When I informed hotel staff that the online agent had spoken with Cristophe (the manager), and presented her with a copy of the agent's e-mail she insisted that she must have a copy for her records. I told her that she could make a copy of mine, but that she could not keep the original. She took a copy and seemed satisfied with this. Secondly, the lift was broken, and they placed us on the 6th floor of the hotel, and informed us that we would have to climb the stairs. This was horrible! Especially with luggage. Every time we wanted to go in or out of the hotel, it was six flights up and down. Furthermore, there was no central heating in the room, only a little portable plug-in radiator that had to be left on continuously in order to keep the room somewhat warm. We were promised a "city view" room - the only view was of a square courtyard facing four other apartments/flats through a large glass wall / window that had to have the drapes drawn at all times! You could barely see a slice of sky, never mind nothing at all of the city. Also, there are no electronic locks or keys. We were issued with a very large key on a fob and told that we had to turn the key in before we left the hotel (every time!!!) because they only had one key for each room, and they would not let the keys leave the premises. This was quite disconcerting as it left questions as the security of our personal belongings. Then, after New Years day, they asked us if we wanted to move to a lower floor, as rooms had become available. When I enquired as to whether or not this would be at the quoted price of 89.00 euros as agreed, I was informed that no, the lower rooms were more expensive, and we would - again - have to pay the difference in costs ourselves. Thus, we declined. When it came time to check out on the 3rd (at quarter to seven in the morning!) we were dealt with by Bernard, who informed me that Christophe had left him a note and explicit instructions that WE WERE TO PAY THE DIFFERENCE in the room costs, and that he had no recollection of speaking with anyone from LastMinute.com. When I pointed out the copy of the e-mail you sent, he seemed shocked to see it. I again refused to pay any difference in costs, and offered to settle the bill, only to find that they had charged us for Hot water! There was no kettle in the room, and since we had brought our own teabags we had asked for some hot water to make tea - so they charged us for it! Ridiculous!!!! The lift apparently has been "out of service" since the summer of 2008, light fixtures are indeed hanging loose from ceilings and walls, there are previous reports of heating problems on the upper floors and if you are not fluent in French (which thankfully I am) the staff (with the exception of Audree, who is lovely) is indeed quite abrupt with you. I would not return to this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Le Kleber”
Reviews.Author: KatieM1983
Reviews.Content: Le Kleber is set in beautiful surroundings not far from the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. The reception area was stunning and the staff friendly and helpful. The bedroom was more spacious than you would expect for the centre of Paris, and was very clean and tidy. Newly refurbished bathroom and plasma screen TV. Jacuzzi bath was amazing after a long day walking around Paris. Set close to the Champs Elysee so many shops and restaurants to chose from. The tube is near by and you can easily get to other areas of Paris - Notre Damn, Louvre. Lovely continental breakfast served in beautiful breakfast room. I would highly recommend this hotel to any couple looking for a romantic get away. It seem standard for there to be a large pane of glass seperating the bedroom and en suite but this is not a problem. Quite possibly one of the most beautiful boutique hotel i have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Basil Fawlty has moved.....”
Reviews.Author: Kergohy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my elderly parents because it was beautifully positioned between the Arc de Triomphe and the Trocadero. It is all that, and the public areas are very pretty, but oh dear..... Avoid room 502 unless you are of an exhibitionist nature - the en suite has a wall of glass thru which you can watch the telly, the street outside, the neighbours across the street. The best thing about the room was the mattress, but the bedding had holes in, the blanket was for a single bed and the lights above the bed were at alarming angles. The wardrobe looked like it had been chucked out in the 30's and the door wouldn't stay shut. We still don't know how to find out what was on the telly - there was no hotel information of any kind in the room. My parents' room was over a building site, which made for anything but a restful stay, they were short on towels (one bath towel between two and housekeeping simply added another hand towel when asked for another....) There was no telephone in the room and the basin had no plug. This is supposed to be a 3*+ hotel but leaving the masking tape over everything on the landing after the decorators left questions the management's attention to detail. And as for the management!!! Well, after being harangued by someone I later discovered was probably the manager, tho he didn't introduce himself and the staff were forbidden to tell me who he was (!), I have to say this would not be my choice for a stay in Paris, no matter how well it's placed. Such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy bed bugs, you will enjoy this place”
Reviews.Author: Klebersucks
Reviews.Content: We have traveled a great deal all throughout Europe, and this by far was the WORST possible place to stay. The rooms were cramped, dirty and the beds had bed bugs. The staff was incredibly rude and unpleasant at every opportunity. We spent as little time as possible in this place, and upon check out, the manager (rude to the hilt) had the audacity to try and charge us for alcohol from the minibar when we don't even drink. They were unhelpful with information about the city, perhaps because the entire staff was not French or Parisian but Middle Eastern. RUDE, DIRTY, RUDE, FILTHY, and did I say RUDE?

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Naish
Reviews.Content: BAD: Shabby litle room Very bad shower old towels We checked 2 additional rooms but they were the same Old smelly carpet... Needs upgrade Tiny elevator - The suitcase did not fit in I had to pay for the first night - but couldn't sleep there so I took another hotel GOOD: location Unless they renewed the place - better to stay out

Reviews.Title: “Take note of the poor reviews....”
Reviews.Author: HK71
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start off by saying that this is not a terrible hotel. But, the super-positive reviews on this site are very very questionable. I stayed at this hotel for 5 days in April. Arrival: I arrived and they gave me the key to a room that someone was already in! Then they wanted me to stay 2 nights at another one of their hotels. Not good enough! They eventually gave me another room, which was the same price level as the one I booked. Room: I had a room with a spa. But saw all other rooms. (they gave me keys to other rooms to look at when the room they wanted to give me was already occupied) All room were very average. Not much differnce between them, except for the bathroom - some with spa, some with a bath with jets, some with hydro-shower. The rooms have floorboards, with tiles in the bathroom. No curtain around the bath/shower. Problems: I am very casual, but even I was frustrated at the lack of professionalism of this hotel. No pillowslips on the spare pillows. Only one bathrobe. The bin disappearred on Day 3. Did not change towels when they were on the floor. The fridge had food from the last occupier in it. The door was very very thin and I could here the alarm in the morning from an adjacent room. Oh, and only French tv, no English channels. Location: Yes, a good location. In between the Arc and the Tower. Great cafes and bars within 100metres. Staff: Helpful. Some more than others. I am sure that the management will read this and they will know who is more helpful - they know who they are. Would I stay here again? Absolutely not. They clearly don't want return business and they are taking advantage of one-off tourists. Three points that I would like to make (any Trip Advisor member who has stayed here, please fee free to disagree): 1. Look at the positive reviews, like I have just done and they are all done by people who joined to Trip Advisor and their last visit was on the same day. 2. Also, the majority of the good reviews have everying at "5 out of 5". How many hotels on this site get EVERYTHING at the top score???? Take a look at the Top 5 rated hotels in Paris. Even those members who rate a Hotel with a 5, might see that one area should be rated a 4 or 3. But not Kleber, when someone rates a 5, all areas are a 5. 3. Quite a few of those high ratings are supposedly from the USA, and I would say that those travelling from the USA are more likely than others to not put up with anything substandard, but their reviews are positively glowing. I would strongly recommend you ignore anything that is 5 out of 5 aand take more not of the "balanced" reviews. BTW, the jacuzzi (spa bath) is only a normal bath with jets in it. Nothing THAT special.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear!”
Reviews.Author: FemaleLondon
Reviews.Content: Sadly this hotel did not live up to expectation. The location was good, the decor quaint but our room was tiny, unclean and the staff were rude and disruptive. One member of reception staff, who I can only describe as a French Basil Fawlty, kept trying to sell us excursions whilst trying to collect our key/order a taxi. He became quite rude and surly after several polite declines to his offers. Even our return at 1am one night did not stop him trying to flog us a few trips, despite our both having been to Paris on several occasions and stating we had our own plans! The hotel room was cramped, dirty and jacuzzi sprouted rust rather than bubbling streams of water. The towels were stained and place was generally unclean. We we woken up by the cleaners etc singing/chatting in the hotel corridors in the early hours of the morning. All in all not a pleasant stay; I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I loved it better --”
Reviews.Author: P-Hopper
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kleber is incredibly convenient to the famous Champs-Elysées (which, frankly, is losing some of the magic, when we were there, the trees were not lit at night, a shame.) But I digress, back to the ROOM. EVALUATION OF ROOM FIRST, Don't be fooled by the grand description of the words "Executive" and "Jacuzzi" as listed on their website. While there was a tub with jets attached, I would hardly call it a Jacuzzi in the truest sense. Forget bringing your beloved for a romantic bubble bath for two unless you don't mind going one at a time! The bathtub in our room was not very appealing and the jets were coated in grime. Obviously, the houskeeping staff never put in elbow grease, as you can see from the photos (even though they are grainy.) Another completely odd feature of the bathroom was the complete lacking a shower curtain or rail, so when showering, all the water just poured onto the floor, which was mildly disconcerting as the space was not really set out as a wet room... if you weren't careful, you could 'break your neck" on the shower water, but really, that wouldn't have happened because, the bathroom was so small, you would have knocked yourself out cold on the wash basin on the way down. And how small was the room? Let's say, that if you had ordered a pizza, you would have to climb over the bed to unlock the door and the pizza person would have to sidle into the room sideways like we did upon entry. The door opened directly onto the bed. I did not like this one bit. I kept wanting to turn the bed 90 degrees counter clockwise to give the illusion of more space as that would have been all that there was, an illusion. Noisy Hallways and you could hear the folks who were staying for a conference getting ready for their meetings at 5:30 am as they clomped in high heels or wingtips, it was so loud and echo-y that I thought in my sleepened haze, that I had left our door open. Nevermind, I could have just nudged it with my elbow to shut it while still in bed. The balcony, ok, well, the big window with some space outside of it, led to a view of a claustrophobic inner courtyard that could be described as a tube or funnel like effect. It was particularly useful for checking the weather as you could look up and see a A4 sized sky to gauge the day by.... useful. THE POSITIVES: Uh, internet access, we think, we could never discover where this was hiding as there was no information in your room to guide you to area interests or features of the hotel. The biggest biggest plus was the proximity to the Champs and the relative price. I think you could do better though. THE STAFF Nice enough but they did not stand out at all as caring or interested in the fact that you chose them over anybody else. As a matter of fact, those who worked in the boulangeries, were much friendlier and I only had to pay them the price of a baguette for a smile and a bonjour! SAFE NEIGHBORHOOD Very very close to all the tourist spots but with some breathing room from the hustle and bustle. Also within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The photo I took was a view between streets two blocks away. A five minute walk and you are there at the famous landmark itself. As this was a honeymoon stay, i was quite disappointed. I have stayed in every type of hotel, resort, b&b and youth hostel so I think I know a little about what a facility should offer from penny pinching to pretension. This place slightly masquerades itself as something more than what it really is. I would deem it perfect for s a business traveler or traveler on a two day stint. Anymore than two days NOT recommended. Would I stay again? Only if i saw and personally chose the room before checking in, and then only if i hadn't the time to explore other options. BTW skip the overpriced breakfast. You can get much better at any corner boulangerie.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Arkenthell
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about this place from previous reviews. However I was pleasantly surprised by the place. It was bigger than I thought it would be. The staff were nice. The location was amazing! There were some small things that annoyed me though. The plumping was obviously old, no price list for the mini bar or other facilities. My room faced onto the street so during the weekdays it was noisy but that can’t really be helped. Didn’t eat there because there was a nice place next door that served breakfast for €6.50 instead of €14 in the hotel. All in all not too bad, definitely not worth the prices they usually charge but if you can get it cheep go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming 16 A. hotel”
Reviews.Author: teezee
Reviews.Content: A delightful 16th A. location, close to trains and walkable to great Paris sites. Staff was courteous and helpful: made restaurant reservations, printed maps, and collaborated with us in making our visit seamless. The hotel is small and charming: we had a king-sized bed and tiny sitting area, and a lovely bathroom, more than we usually get in Paris for the price. Make reservations early and you may find an internet bargain here. If you make your reservations with a web site and not directly through the hotel, reconfirm directly with the hotel before arrival. Given its small size, its best to be sure they are expecting you! And remember to lock your room with your key, it doesn't lock itself!! We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for a couple of nights, room was small but very clean and quiet. Location great for Arc de Triomphe and 10 mins walk from Eiffel Tower. Area very quiet and relaxed, but we used the metro to travel to the more livelier places like the Latin quarter and St Michel. Staff very friendly and helpful, overall a great place to stay for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Kleber Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lottielock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Kleber hotel for our 1st wedding anniversary. We were slightly worried by a couple of bad reviews we had read on here since booking the holiday but were generally happy with our choice. The location is fab – really good walking distance from most tourist things. The hotel was quaint and our room was just ok. We had read there were Jacuzzi baths in some rooms but none available for us. Instead we were given a room with a “hydroshower”. Don’t be fooled by it’s fancy title, it’s just a shower with 3 variants of weak pressure. We also had to wait ages for hot water to come through the system which was very frustrating. We also had a problem with our safe but the friendly chap on reception was quick to help and resolved the issue promptly. Most of the staff are friendly, except one man who was particularly unhelpful when we asked for advice on a good restaurant. He assumed we wanted to stick to the Champs Elysees area and told us that all restaurants would be full without a reservation. We decided to ignore his unhelpful advice and found 2 good restaurants for 2 evenings (without booking). L’Appart in Rue de Colisee was an excellent restaurant offering a wide range of contempary cuisine and really good service. The cafes around the Louvre area are also very good and worth dining in for an evening meal. Overall, Kleber hotel is good value for money for a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & romantic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The kleber hotel champs elysees is a lovely little jewel located in the gold triangle & within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. It is a very safe area within walking distance to the "crowd", the "shops", the restaurants & monuments & famous museums ( Fashion, Modern Art...) Our room was perfect, I don't have one bad thing to say about it. The bathroom was luxurious, the room was very clean ( I'm one of those people who tries to find fault with hotel rooms and I couldn't with this one ! ) The staff were genuinely nice, and were never overlly nice. Breakfast was lovely, and we were treated so well. The service overall at this hotel is outstanding, the receptionists are helpful, the housekeepers are friendly and very thorough. On our departure day they looked after our luggage for us until we came back to the hotel at 9 pm to pick up the taxi. No more Paris hotel research for me ever again; henceforth, bourgeoise home in Paris is the kleber hotel Champs Elysees Paris. It is a splendid charming hotel in a very nice location. I will definitely come back there !

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of this hotel and its sister hotel Les Jardins du Trocadero”
Reviews.Author: rrrsharon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in February via the internet and had confirmation in writing exactly what we were to expect. We also chose it specifically for its proximity to the Champs Elysee as we were running the Paris marathon on Sunday, 9th April and it was also running a special winter offer price for a room with jacuzzi, ideal for relaxing after the marathon. We checked in on Friday night, 7th April and given the key to a room with no jacuzzi. We asked at reception what the problem was. The man there was unhelpful and seemed to find it funny that we hadn't got what we asked for and told us to see the hotel manager next morning. He also said that we could use the suite for an extra 50€ per night and we refused. Next day, the manager was unavailable, we were told to go back in the afternoon when it would be sorted. We arrived back to be told that there was a room with jacuzzi for us in their sister hotel. So we traipsed with suitcases a 15 min walk to this hotel and checked in. We then got a phone call from the manager to say we couldn't stay in this room unless we paid an extra 50€ per night. We refused and said we needed to go out and would he sort this for when we got back. We returned and it was 6pm on Saturday by this time, the manager still refused to give us this room unless we coughed up the extra money. In the meantime he said he'd booked us into another hotel which wasn't convenient for us as it involved 2 tube stops away from the marathon start. We refused this again and said we would camp in reception unless he sorted something out for us. At that moment, there just happened to be a police car outside and he asked us to step outside and speak to them. We refused so he spoke to them himself and after a lengthy conversation asked me to explain in French what had happened. They took our passports in the meantime so we really had to do what they said or we wouldn't have got them back. In the end we were bundled into a taxi to the other hotel in the Opera district which was very basic and obviously a lot cheaper than the Kleber Hotel which we had booked originally. It was clean and comfortable but not ideal for a marathon weekend. We have made complaints in writing to both hotels and to the Paris tourist board. On returning home we have found that the Hotel Kleber have deducted our bank account with 144€ and 200€. We have no idea what these amounts are for and they were instructed in writing not to debit our account, so they have breached this. We will be taking this matter further. I do not recommend a stay at this hotel to anyone. It has bad management and a lack of customer service skills not experienced at any other hotel we have visited in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dunningfamily
Reviews.Content: Read the other reviews on this hotel and it sounded wonderful so we were a little disappointed with our room. Expected something a little better. Bedroom was very small and although the curtains and bed cover looked clean and new the sheets/blankets looked very worn. Could just about work around the bed. Hotel is situated on quite a busy road which can be troublesome during the evening as the windows are only sealed units and have not been properly double glazed. The window in our room was cracked so quite dangerous. Bathroom was basic but clean but shower was dismal - this could be because we were on a high floor. Hotel is a little tired I would say. Location is good, in between the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. Metro stops 5 mins up or down the road from the Hotel Kleber. I wouldn't stay again but if you can get a good deal then it may be worth giving it a go.

Reviews.Title: “very nice & charming place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed on december 2005 at Hotel Kleber Paris and I really enjoyed my stay there. (it is one of my two favourite place in Paris). It is a splendid small charming hotel with a very nice location. Champs Elysées & Eiffel tower are within walking distance. Therefore the location can't be beat for a first trip to Paris ! Staff are very friendly & speaks english very well. Lobby staff were very sweet & quite helpful in booking taxis and recommending non-touristy places to eat. Our housekeeper was the BEST. The room was spotless clean every evening when we returned ! This hotel was exceptionally clean: always fresh towels, clean sheets and clean bathroom. Amazing ! The bed was comfortable, lots of hot water with the shower, and the rack for the towels was a nice touch. I used the computer in the basement several times for Internet access. I had a room with a large jacuzzi ! it was great ! If your looking for a nice, luxury, clean, ideally located hotel in Paris at a reasonable price, check it out. The whole hotel is tastefully decorated. Highly recommended, particularly for the price All said, I'll definitely stay here again. I can't imagine a better location or a nicer staff.
